bug.author: msbuckas
bug.description:
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'ipywidgets' <denchmark-code>--------------------------------------------------------------------------- ModuleNotFoundError Traceback (most recent call last) ~\Miniconda3\envs\jlab2\lib\site-packages\IPython\core\formatters.py in __call__(self, obj) 343 method = get_real_method(obj, self.print_method) 344 if method is not None: --> 345 return method() 346 return None 347 else:
~\Miniconda3\envs\jlab2\lib\site-packages\pandas_profiling\__init__.py in _repr_html_(self) 222 def _repr_html_(self): 223 """The ipython notebook widgets user interface gets called by the jupyter notebook.""" --> 224 self.to_widgets() 225 226 def __repr__(self):
~\Miniconda3\envs\jlab2\lib\site-packages\pandas_profiling\__init__.py in to_widgets(self) 210 from IPython.core.display import display, HTML 211 --> 212 report = WidgetReport(self.report).render() 213 214 display(report)
~\Miniconda3\envs\jlab2\lib\site-packages\pandas_profiling\report\presentation\flavours\flavours.py in WidgetReport(structure) 59 60 def WidgetReport(structure: Type[Renderable]): ---> 61 from pandas_profiling.report.presentation.flavours.widget import ( 62 WidgetSequence, 63 WidgetPreview,
~\Miniconda3\envs\jlab2\lib\site-packages\pandas_profiling\report\presentation\flavours\widget\__init__.py in <module> ----> 1 from pandas_profiling.report.presentation.flavours.widget.frequency_table import ( 2 WidgetFrequencyTable, 3 ) 4 from pandas_profiling.report.presentation.flavours.widget.frequency_table_small import ( 5 WidgetFrequencyTableSmall,
~\Miniconda3\envs\jlab2\lib\site-packages\pandas_profiling\report\presentation\flavours\widget\frequency_table.py in <module> 1 from IPython.core.display import display ----> 2 from ipywidgets import widgets, HTML 3 4 from pandas_profiling.report.presentation.core.frequency_table import FrequencyTable 5
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'ipywidgets' --------------------------------------------------------------------------- </denchmark-code>
Code To Reproduce <denchmark-code>import pandas_profiling as pf pf.ProfileReport(ts) </denchmark-code>
Version information:
Windows: 10 Python version: 3.7.6 Environment: Conda + JupyterLab JupyterLab: 2.0.0 Pandas: 1.0.1 pandas_profiling: 2.4.0

comments.comment:
Resolved by <denchmark-code>conda install ipywidgets </denchmark-code>
This dependancy is perhaps not explicitly stated? The newer versions of JupyterLab (and Pandas) may not be installing ipywidgets anymore?
Thanks for reporting this. We're resolving this in the conda recipe.
